aartis.desc:
Shree Siddhivinayak Mantra is a sacred Hindu mantra that is recited to invoke the blessings of Lord Ganesha. The mantra is also known as the Ganapati Mantra or the Ganesh Gayatri Mantra. The mantra is composed of three parts, each of which is recited for a specific purpose. The first part is recited to invoke Lord Ganesha's blessings for wisdom and knowledge. The second part is recited to invoke his blessings for strength and courage. The third part is recited to invoke his blessings for success and prosperity. The mantra is usually recited three times a day, in the morning, afternoon and evening. It can also be recited during puja or any other religious ceremony.

Shree Siddhivinayak Aarti is a sacred Hindu ritual that is performed to invoke the blessings of Lord Ganesha. The aarti is also known as the Ganesh Aarti or the Ganapati Aarti. The aarti is performed by lighting a lamp or a candle and waving it in a clockwise direction around the idol or image of Lord Ganesha. This is followed by the recitation of the Shree Siddhivinayak Mantra. The aarti is usually performed three times a day, in the morning, afternoon and evening.
aartis.title: Shree Siddhivinayak Mantra And Aarti

aartis.content:
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare,
Swami Jai Paunahari Hare,
Bhakt Janon Ki Naiya,
Das Janon Ki Naiya,
Bhav Se Paar Kare,
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥
Balak Umar Suhani,
Naam Balak Natha,
Amar Hue Shankar Se,
Sun Ke Amar Gatha ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Sheesh Pe Bal Sunaihari,
Gale Rudrakshi Mala,
Hath Mein Jholi Chimata,
Aasan Mrgashala ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Sundar Seli Singee,
Vairagan Sohe,
Gau Palak Rakhavalak,
Bhagatan Mann Mohe ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Ang Bhabhoot Ramai,
Murti Prabhu Rangi,
Bhay Bhanjan Duhkh Nashak,
Bharathari Ke Sangi ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Rot Chadhat Raviwar Ko,
Phal, Phool Mishri Mewa,
Dhup Deep Kudanun Se,
Aanand Siddh Dewa ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Bhaktan Hit Avatar Liyo,
Prabhu Dekh Ke Kallu Kala,
Dusht Daman Shatruhan,
Sabake Pratipala ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Shri Balak Nath Ji Ki Aarti,
Jo Koi Nit Gave,
Kahate Hai Sewak Tere,
Man Vancchhit Phal Pawe ।
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥

Om Jai Kaladhari Hare,
Swami Jai Paunahari Hare,
Bhakt Janon Ki Naiya,
Das Janon Ki Naiya,
Bhav Se Paar Kare,
Om Jai Kaladhari Hare ॥
aartis.desc: The aarti of Shri Baba Balaknath is a very beautiful and sacred ritual. It is performed in order to worship and honor the great saint Baba Balaknath. This aarti is usually sung by devotees in the morning and evening, and it is considered to be very auspicious. The lyrics of the aarti are very powerful and they invoke the blessings of Baba Balaknath. The aarti is also a very good way to connect with the divine energy of Baba Balaknath.
aartis.title: Shri Baba Balaknath Aarti

aartis.content:
Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal,
Hem Mandir Shobhitam ।
Nikat Ganga Bahat Nirmal,
Shri Badrinath Vishwmbharam ॥
Shesh Sumiran Karat Nishadin,
Dharat Dhyan Maheshwaram ।
Ved Brahma Karat Stuti,
Shri Badrinath Vishwambharam ॥
॥ Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal...॥

Shakti Gauri Ganesh Sharad,
Narad Muni Uchcharanam ।
Jog Dhyan Apar Leela,
Shri Badrinath Vishwmbharam ॥
॥ Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal...॥

Indra Chandra Kuber Dhuni Kar,
Dhoop Deep Prakashitam ।
Siddh Munijan Karat Jai Jai,
Badrinath Vishwmbharam ॥
॥ Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal...॥

Yaksh Kinnar Karat Kautuk,
Gyan Gandharv Prakashitam ।
Shri Lakshmi Kamala Chanvaradol,
Shri Badrinath Vishwmbharam ॥
॥ Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal...॥

Kailash Main Ek Dev Niranjan,
Shail Shikhar Maheshwaram ।
RajYudhishthir Karat Stuti,
Shri Badrinath Vishwmbharam ॥
॥ Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal...॥

Shri BadriJi Ke Panch Ratna,
Padhat Paap Vinashanam ।
Koti Teerth Bhavet Puny,
Prapyate Phaladayakam ॥
॥ Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal...॥

Pawan Mand Sugandh Sheetal,
Hem Mandir Shobhitam ।
Nikat Ganga Bahat Nirmal,
Shri Badrinath Vishwmbharam ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Badrinath Aarti is a sacred Hindu hymn that is sung in praise of the deity Badrinath. This aarti is usually performed during the puja ceremony, and it is considered to be very auspicious. The lyrics of the aarti praise Badrinath for his divine qualities, and the singer also requests the deity to bless them with health, wealth and happiness. The aarti is a very beautiful and moving prayer, and it is sure to fill the heart of the listener with divine bliss.
aartis.title: Shri Badrinath Aarti

aartis.content:
Aarti Bal Krishna Ki Keeje,
Apna Janam Safal Kar Leejen ॥
Shri Yashoda Ka Param Dulara,
Baba Ke Ankhiyan Ka Tara।
Gopiyan Ke Pranan Se Pyara,
In Pe Pran Nyochavar Keeje॥
॥ Aarti Bal Krishna Ki Keeje...॥

Baldau Ke Chote Bhaiya,
Kanua Kahi Kahi Bole Maiya।
Param Mudit Man Let Balaiya,
Ye Chavi Nainan Mein Bhar Leeje॥
॥ Aarti Bal Krishna Ki Keeje...॥

Shri Radhavar Kunwar Kanahiya,
Braj Jan Ko Navneet Khavaiya।
Dekhat Hi Man Lait Churaiya,
Apno Sarvas Inko Deeje॥
॥ Aarti Bal Krishna Ki Keeje...॥

Totali Bolan Madhur Suhave,
Sakhan Sang Khelat Sukh Pave।
Soi Sukati Jo Inko Dhyave,
Ab Inko Apna Kar Leejen॥
॥ Aarti Bal Krishna Ki Keeje...॥

Aarti Bal Krishna Ki Keeje,
Apna Janam Safal Kar Leejen॥
aartis.desc: In Hinduism, Bal Krishna is the child form of Krishna. Aarti is the Hindu practice of singing devotional songs and waving an oil lamp or incense in front of an image of a deity. The aarti for Bal Krishna is a beautiful devotional song that is sung to worship him. The lyrics of the aarti praise Bal Krishna's divine qualities and express the devotee's love and devotion for him. The aarti is often accompanied by the ringing of bells and the waving of lamps. The sight and sound of the aarti is said to be very beautiful and peaceful. It is a great way to show your devotion to Bal Krishna and to receive his blessings.
aartis.title: Shri Bal Krishna Ki Keejen

aartis.content:
Om Jai Hanumat Veera,
Swami Jai Hanuat Veera ।
Sankat Mochan Swami,
Tum ho Randhira ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥
Pawan Putra Anjani Sut,
mahima ati bhari ।
Dukh Daridra mitao,
Sankat sab hari ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Bal Samay Mein Tumne,
Ravi Ko Bhaksh Liyo ।
Devan Stuti Kinhee,
Turahin Chor Diyo ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Kapi Sugreev Ram Sang,
Maitri Karvai ।
Abhimani Bali Metyo,
Kirti Rahi Chai ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Jari Lank Siye Sudhi Le Aaye,
Vanar Harshaye ।
Karaj Kathin Sudhare,
Raghuvar Maan Bhaye ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Shakti Lagi Lakshman Ko,
Bhari Soch Bhayo ।
Lay Sanjivan Booti,
Dukh Sab Door Kiyo ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Ramahi Le Ahiravan,
Jabh Patal Gayo।
Tahi Mari Prabhu Lay,
Jai Jaikar Bhayo ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Rajat Memdhipur Mein,
Darshan Sukhkari ।
Mangal Aur Shanischar,
Mela Hai Jari ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥

Shri Balaji Ki Aarti,
Jo Koi Nar Gave।
Kahat Indra Harshit,
Maan Vanchhit Phal Pave ॥
॥ Om Jai Hanumat Veera..॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Balaji Hanumat Veera Aarti is a beautiful and sacred prayer dedicated to Lord Hanuman, the devoted disciple of Lord Rama. This aarti is sung in praise of Lord Hanuman's boundless devotion, strength and courage. It is said that by chanting this aarti with sincere devotion, one can attain the blessings of Lord Hanuman and be blessed with strength, courage and success in all their endeavours.
aartis.title: Shri Balaji Hanumat Veera Aarti

aartis.content:
Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon,
Hey Giridhar Teri Aarti Gaoon ।
Aarti Gaoon Pyare Aapako Rijhaoon,
Shyam Sundar Teri Aarti Gaoon ।
॥ Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon..॥
Mor Mukut Pyare Sheesh Pe Sohe,
Pyari Bansi Mero Man Mohe ।
Dekh Chhavi Balihari Main Jaoon ।
॥ Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon..॥

Charanon Se Nikali Ganga Pyari,
Jisane Sari Duniya Tari ।
Main Un Charanon Ke Darshan Paoon ।
॥ Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon..॥

Das Anath Ke Nath Aap Ho,
Duhkh-Sukh Jeevan Pyare Sath Aap Ho ।
Hari Charanon Mein Sheesh Jhukaoon ।
॥ Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon..॥

Shri Haridas Ke Pyare Tum Ho,
Mere Mohan Jeevan Dhan Ho ।
Dekh Yugal Chhavi Bali-Bali Jaoon ।
॥ Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon..॥

Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaoon,
Hey Giridhar Teri Aarti Gaoon ।
Aarti Gaoon Pyare Aapako Rijhaoon,
Shyam Sundar Teri Aarti Gaoon ।
aartis.desc: The Shri Banke Bihari Aarti is a beautiful devotional song dedicated to Lord Krishna. The lyrics of the song praise Lord Krishna's divine form and describe his many qualities and attributes. The song is sung with great devotion and love, and is sure to touch the hearts of all who hear it.
aartis.title: Shri Banke Bihari Teri Aarti Gaun

aartis.content:
Shri Bhagwat Bhagavan Ki Hai Aarti,
Papiyon Ko Paap Se Hai Tarti।
Ye Amar Granth Ye Mukti Panth,
Ye Pancham Ved Nirala,
Nav Jyoti Jalane wala।
Hari Naam Yahi Hari Dham Yahi,
Yahi Jag Mangal Ki Aarti
Papiyon Ko Paap Se Hai Tarti॥
॥ Shri Bhagwat Bhagavan Ki...॥

Ye Shanti Geet Pavan Puneet,
Papon Ko Mitane Wala,
Hari Darash Dikhane Wala।
Yah Sukh Karani, Yah Duhkh Harini,
Shri Madhusoodan Ki Aarti,
Papiyon Ko Paap Se Hai Tarti॥
॥ Shri Bhagwat Bhagavan Ki...॥

Ye Madhur Bol, Jag Phand Khol,
Sanmarg Dikhane Wala,
Bigadee Ko Banane Wala।
Shri Ram Yahi, Ghanashyam Yahi,
Yahi Prabhu Ki Mahima Ki Aarti
Papiyon Ko Paap Se Hai Tarti॥

Shri Bhagwat Bhagavan Ki Hai Aarti,
Papiyon Ko Paap Se Hai Tarti।
aartis.desc: The Bhagwat Bhagwan Aarti is a devotional song sung in praise of the Hindu deity, Lord Krishna. It is a beautiful and moving composition that is sure to fill the listener with a sense of peace and devotion. The lyrics are simple and elegant, and the melody is both catchy and soothing. This aarti is sure to become a favorite among Krishna devotees.
aartis.title: Shri Bhagwat Bhagwan Ki Aarti

aartis.content:
Jai Brihaspati Deva,
Om Jai Brihaspati Deva ।
Chhin Chhin Bhog Laga‌on,
Kadli Phal Meva ॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Tum Puran Paramatma,
Tum Antaryami ।
Jagatapita Jagadishvar,
Tum Sabake Swami ॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Charanamrt Nij Nirmal,
Sab Patak Harta ।
Sakal Manorath Dayak,
Kripa Karo Bharta ॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Tan, Man, Dhan Arpan Kar,
Jo Jan Sharan Pade ।
Prabhu Prakat Tab Hokar,
Aakar Dwar Khade ॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Deenadayal Dayanidhi,
Bhaktan Hitakari ।
Paap Dosh Sab Harta,
Bhav Bandhan Haree ॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Sakal Manorath Dayak,
Sab Sanshay Haro ।
Vishay Vikar Mita‌o,
Santan Sukhakari॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Jo Koi Aarti Teri,
Prem Sahit Gave ।
Jethanand Aanandakar,
So Nishchay Pave ॥
॥ Om Jai Brihaspati Deva..॥

Sab Bolo Vishnu Bhagawan Ki Jai ॥
Bolo Brihaspati Bhagawan Ki Jai ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Brihaspati Dev Aarti is a devotional hymn dedicated to Brihaspati, the Hindu god of wisdom and learning. The aarti consists of a series of verses praising Brihaspati and seeking his blessings. It is often recited by students before exams, or by anyone seeking knowledge and wisdom. The aarti begins with a invocation of Brihaspati, asking him to bestow his blessings upon the devotee. It then goes on to praise Brihaspati's qualities, such as his wisdom, his knowledge, and his ability to guide and teach. The aarti ends with a request for Brihaspati's blessings, and a promise to always respect and honor him.
aartis.title: Shri Brihaspati Dev Ji Ki Aarti

aartis.content:
Om Jai Chitragupt Hare,
Swami Jai Chitragupt Hare।
Bhaktajanon Ke Ichchhit,
Phal Ko Poorn Kare॥
Vighn Vinashak Mangalkarta,
Santan Sukhadayi
Bhakton Ke Pratipalak,
Tribhuvan Yash Chhayi॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Roop Chaturbhuj, Shyamal Moorat,
Peetambar Rajai।
Matu Iravati,
Dakshina, Vaam Ang Sajai॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Kasht Nivarak, Dusht Sanharak,
Prabhu Antaryami।
Srashti Samharan, Jan Dukh Haran,
Prakat Bhaye Swami॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Kalam, Dawat, Shankh, Patrika,
Kar Me Ati Sohai।
Vaijaianti Vanamala,
Tribhuvan Man Mohai॥

Vishwa Nyay Ka Kary Sambhala,
Bramha Harshaye।
Koti Koti Devata Tumhare,
Charanan Me Dhaye॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Nrap Sudas Aru Bheeshm Pitamah,
Yaad Tumhen Keenha।
Veg, Vilamb Na Keenhaun,
Ichchhit Phal Deenha॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Dara, Sut, Bhagini,
Sab Apane Swasth Ke Karta।
Jaoon Kahan Sharan Me Kisaki,
Tum Taj Main Bharta॥

Bandhu, Pita Tum Swami,
Sharan Gahoon Kisaki।
Tum Bin Aur Na Dooja,
Aas Karoon Jisaki॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Jo Jan Chitragupt Ji Ki Aarti,
Prem Sahit Gavain।
Chaurasi Se Nishchit Chhootain,
Ichchhit Phal Pavain॥
॥ Om Jai Chitragupt Hare...॥

Nyayadhish Bainkunth Niwasi,
Pap Punya Likhate।
Nanak Sharan Tihare,
Aas Na Dooji Karate॥

Om Jai Chitragupt Hare,
Swami Jai Chitragupt Hare।
Bhaktajanon Ke Ichchhit,
Phal Ko Poorn Kare॥
aartis.desc: Shri Chitragupt is considered to be the supreme deity of the Hindu pantheon. He is the god of justice and is responsible for maintaining the cosmic order. He is often depicted as holding a scales in one hand and a sword in the other. The Shri Chitragupt Aarti is a beautiful devotional song that praises the lord for his greatness. The lyrics of the song extol the virtues of the lord and describe him as the protector of the universe. The song is an excellent way to show devotion to the lord and to seek his blessings.
aartis.title: Shri Chitragupt Aarti

aartis.content:
Shri Viranchi Kulbhushan,
Yampur Ke Dhami ।
Puny Paap Ke Lekhak,
Chitrgupt Swami ॥
Siss Mukut, Kaanon Mein Kundal,
Ati Sohe ।
Shyamvarn Shashi Sa Mukh,
Sabke Man Mohe ॥

Bhaal Tilak Se Bhushit,
Lochan Suvishala ।
Shankh Sarikhi Gardan,
Gale Mein Manimala ॥

Ardh Shareer Janeu,
Lambi Bhuja Chhajai ।
Kamal Dawat Hath Mein,
Paaduk Para Bhraje ॥

Nrp Saudas Anarthi,
Tha Ati Balvala ।
Aapki Krpa Dwara,
Surpur Pag Dhara ॥

Bhakti Bhav Se Yah,
Aarti Jo Koi Gave ।
Manavanchhit Phal Pakar,
Sadgati Pave ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Chitragupt Aarti Shri Viranchi Kulbhusan is a divine aarti recited in honor of Lord Chitragupta, the presiding deity of the Chitra Nakshatra. The aarti is a beautiful composition that extols the virtues of Lord Chitragupta and His divine qualities. It is said that reciting this aarti with sincere devotion and devotion will help us attain the blessings of Lord Chitragupta and attain our desired goals.
aartis.title: Shri Chitragupt Aarti Shri Viranchi Kulbhusan

aartis.content:
Trigunatmak traimurti dutt ha jana |
Triguni avatar trailokyarana ||

Neti neti shabda na ye anumana |
Survar munijan yogi Samadhi na ye dhyana ||

Jai dev jai dev jai shrigurudutta |
Aarti ovalinta harali bhavachinta ||

Sabahya abyantari tu ekdutt |
Abhagyasi kaichi kalel hi maat ||

Parahi paratali tethe kaicha het |
Janmamaranacha Purlase anta ||

Dutt yeoniya ubha thakla |
Sashtange namuni pranipat kela ||

Prasanna houni ashirwad didhala |
Janmamaranacha fera chukvila ||

Dutt dutt aise lagle dhyan |
Harpale man jhale unman ||

Mi tu panachi jhali bolvan |
Eka janardani shri dutt dhyan ||

Jai dev jai dev jai ||
aartis.desc: The Shri Datta Aarti is a beautiful and moving devotional song that pays tribute to the Hindu deity, Dattatreya. This aarti is sung in praise of Dattatreya, who is considered to be an incarnation of the Hindu god Vishnu. The lyrics of the Shri Datta Aarti are full of devotion and love, and they express the deep faith that Hindus have in this deity. The music of the aarti is also very beautiful, and it is sure to touch the hearts of all who hear it.
aartis.title: Shri Datta Aarti

aartis.content:
Jai Ganesh Jai Ganesh,
Jai Ganesg Deva ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥

Ek Dant Daya Want,
Char Bhuuja Dhari ।
Mathe Sindor Shoye,
Muse Ki Sawari ॥

Jai Ganesh Jai Ganesh,
Jai Ganesg Deva ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥

Pan Chadhe Phool Chadhe,
Aur Chadhe Mewa ।
Laduan Ko Bhog Lage,
Sant Kare Sewa ॥

Jai Ganesh Jai Ganesh,
Jai Ganesg Deva ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥

Andhan Ko Aankh Det,
Kodhin Ko Kaya ।
Bajhan Ko Purta Det,
Nirdhan Ko Maya॥

Jai Ganesh Jai Ganesh,
Jai Ganesg Deva ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥

'sur' Shaam Sharan Aaye,
Safal Ki Jiye Sewa ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥

Jai Ganesh Jai Ganesh,
Jai Ganesg Deva ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥

----- Additional -----
Deenan Ki Laaj Rakho,
Shambhu Sutakari ।
Kamana Ko Poorn Karo,
Jaoon Balihari ॥

Jai Ganesh Jai Ganesh,
Jai Ganesg Deva ।
Mata Jaki Parwati,
Pita Maha Deva ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Ganesh Aarti is a popular Hindu devotional song dedicated to Lord Ganesh, the elephant-headed god. It is typically sung during the worship of Lord Ganesh, or during special occasions such as Ganesh Chaturthi. The aarti consists of a series of verses praising Lord Ganesh, and ends with the phrase "Jai Ganesh, Jai Ganesh, Jai Ganesh Deva". The Shri Ganesh Aarti is a beautiful and moving devotional song that is sure to please any devotee of Lord Ganesh. The verses are rich with imagery and praise, and the ending phrase is a powerful affirmation of faith in the Lord. If you are looking for a devotional song to help you connect with Lord Ganesh, the Shri Ganesh Aarti is a great choice.
aartis.title: Shri Ganesh Aarti Jai Ganesh

aartis.content:
Shendur Laal Chadhayo Acchha Gajamukhako ।
Dondil Laal Biraje Sut Gauriharko ।
Hath Liye Gud-laddu Sain Suravarako ।
Mahima Kahe Na Jaay Lagat Hoon Padako ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..
Jai Dev Jai Dev,
Jai Jai Shri Ganaraj
Vidya Sukhadata
Dhany Tumhara Darshan
Mera Man Ramata,
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Ashtau Siddhi Dasi Sankatako Bairi ।
Vighna-vinashan Mangal Murat Adhikari ।
Kotisurajaprakash Aibee Chhabi Teri ।
Gandasthal-madamastak Jhoole Shashibihari ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev,
Jai Jai Shri Ganaraj
Vidya Sukhadata
Dhany Tumhara Darshan
Mera Man Ramata,
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Bhav-bhagat Se Koi Sharanagat Aave ।
Santat Sampat Sabahi Bharapoor Pave ।
Aise Tum Maharaj Moko Ati Bhave ।
Gosavinandan Nishidin Gun Gave ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev,
Jai Jai Shri Ganaraj
Vidya Sukhadata
Dhany Tumhara Darshan
Mera Man Ramata,
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Ganesh Shendur Laal Chadhayo Aarti is a popular Hindu devotional song dedicated to Lord Ganesha. The song is typically sung during the Hindu festival of Ganesh Chaturthi, which is celebrated in honor of Lord Ganesha's birthday. The lyrics of the song praise Lord Ganesha and describe him as the remover of obstacles and the lord of wisdom and prosperity. The song is a beautiful expression of devotion to Lord Ganesha and is sure to fill the heart with joy and happiness.
aartis.title: Shri Ganesh Shendur Laal Chadhayo

aartis.content:
॥ Shri Ganga Maiya Aarti ॥
Har Har Gange, Jai Maa Gange,
Har Har Gange, Jai Maa Gange ॥
Om Jai Gange Mata,
Shri Jai Gange Mata ।
Jo Nar Tumako Dhyata,
Manavanchit Phal Pata ॥

Chandr Si Jot Tumhari,
Jal Nirmal Aata ।
Sharan Paden Jo Teri,
So Nar Tar Jata ॥
॥ Om Jay Gange Mata..॥

Putr Sagar Ke Tare,
Sab Jag Ko Gyata ।
Kripa Drshti Tumhari,
Tribhuvan Sukh Data ॥
॥ Om Jay Gange Mata..॥

Ek Hi Bar Jo Teri,
Sharanagati Aata ।
Yam Ki Traas Mita Kar,
Paramagati Pata ॥
॥ Om Jay Gange Mata..॥

Aarti Maat Tumhari,
Jo Jan Nitya Gata ।
Daas Vahi Sahaj Mein,
Muktti Ko Pata ॥
॥ Om Jay Gange Mata..॥

Om Jai Gange Mata,
Shri Jai Gange Mata ।
Jo Nar Tumako Dhyata,
Manavanchit Phal Pata ॥

Om Jai Gange Mata,
Shri Jai Gange Mata ।
aartis.desc: The Shri Ganga Aarti is a sacred Hindu ritual that is performed in honor of the goddess Ganga. This aarti is usually performed at sunrise or sunset, and it involves the lighting of candles and the chanting of mantras. The Shri Ganga Aarti is believed to purify the mind and body, and it is often used as a way to connect with the divine.
aartis.title: Shri Ganga Aarti

aartis.content:
Aarti Shri Gaiya Maiya Ki,
Aarti Harni Vishav Dheya Ki ॥
Arthkam Sudharm Pradayini,
Avichal Amal Muktipadayini ।
Sur Manav Sobhagya Vidhayini,
Pyari Pujan Nand Cheya ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Gaiya Maiya Ki...॥

Akhil Vishav Prtipalini Mata,
Madhur Ayam Dugdhann Pradata ।
Rog Shok Sankat Pritrata,
Bhavsagar Hit Dand Neya Ki ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Gaiya Maiya Ki...॥

Aayu Aoj Arogya Vikashini,
Dukh Denye Daridra Vinashini ।
Shushma Sokhye Sumudhi Prakashini,
Vimal Vivek Bhudhi Deya Ki ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Gaiya Maiya Ki...॥

Sewak Jo Chahe Dukhdai,
Sam Pye Sudha Piyavati Mayi ।
Shatru Mitra Sabko Dukhdayi,
Sneh Savbhav Vishav Jeya Ki ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Gaiya Maiya Ki...॥

Aarti Shri Gaiya Maiya Ki,
Aarti Harni Vishav Dheya Ki ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Gaumata Aarti is a devotional song dedicated to the divine cow, who is considered to be a symbol of abundance and fertility. The lyrics of the song extol the cow's virtues and her role in sustaining life on earth. The song is traditionally sung at dawn, when the cow is brought out to graze. The act of singing the Shri Gaumata Aarti is believed to bestow blessings of prosperity and good fortune upon the singer and his/her family.
aartis.title: Shri Gaumata Aarti

aartis.content:
॥ Shri Hanuman Stuti ॥
Manojavm maaruta tulyavegam,
jitendriyam buddhimatam varissttha ॥
Vaatatmajam Vaanarayutha mukhyam,
Shriiramdutam sharanam prapadye ॥

॥ Aarti ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ।
Dushat Dalan Ragunath Kala Ki ॥

Jake Bal Se Giriver Kaanpe ।
Rog Dosh Ja Ke Nikat Na Jaanke ॥
Anjani Putra Mahabaldaye ।
Santan Ke Prabhu Sada Sahaye ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ॥

De Beeraha Raghunath Pathai ।
Lanka Jaari Siya Sudhi Laiye॥
Lanka So Kot Samundra Se Khaiy ।
Jaat Pavan Sut Baar Na Laiye ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ॥

Lanka Jaari Asur Sab Maare ।
Siya Ramji Ke Kaaj Sanvare ॥
Lakshman Moorchit Parhe Sakare ।
Aan Sajeevan Pran Ubhaare ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ॥

Paith Pataal Tori Yamkare ।
Ahiravan Ke Bhuja Ukhaare ॥
Baayen Bhuja Asur Dal Mare ।
Daayen Bhuja Sab Santa Jana Tare ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ॥

Surnar Munijan Aarti Utare ।
Jai Jai Jai Hanuman Uchaare ॥
Kanchan Thaar Kapoor Lo Chhai ।
Aarti Karat Aajani Mai ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ॥

Jo Hanumanji Ki Aarti Gaave ।
Basi Baikuntha Amar Padh Pave ॥
Lanka Vidvance Kiye Ragurai ।
Tulsidas Swami Aarti Gaaie ॥
Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ॥

Aarti Ki Jai Hanuman Lala Ki ।
Dushat Dalan Ragunath Kala Ki ॥
॥ Eti Sampuarnam ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Hanuman Lala Aarti is one of the most sacred and popular aartis among the Hindus. It is sung in praise of Lord Hanuman, the monkey god, who is considered to be an incarnation of Lord Shiva. The aarti is usually sung at the end of a puja or a religious ritual. The lyrics of the aarti praise Lord Hanuman for his strength, courage and wisdom. They also ask for his blessings in order to overcome all obstacles in life. The aarti is sung with great devotion and faith by Hindus all over the world. The sight of the devotees singing the aarti with folded hands and closed eyes is a very moving experience. The aura of the aarti fills the air with a sense of peace and calm. It is truly a divine experience.
aartis.title: Shri Hanuman Lala Aarti

aartis.content:
Chaturbhuja Jagannatha
Kantha Sobhita Koustubhaha.. ॥
Padmanaavo, Bedagarvah,
Chandra Surjya Bilochanaha

Jagannatha, Lokanaatha,
Niladrih Sah Paro Hari

Dinabandhurr, Dayasindhu,
Krupaaluh Chana Rakshyakah

Kambu Paani, Chakra Paani,
Padmanaavo, Narattamah…

Jagatang Paaloko Byaapi,
Sarba Byaapi Suresworaaha

Loka Raajo, Deva Raajo,
Chakra Bhupah Schabhupatihhi

Niladrih Badrinaathah Scha,
Aanantah Purusottamahha

Taarkshodhyaayoh, Kalpataruhh,
Bimalaa Priti Bardhanaha

Balabhadroh , Baasudevoh
, Maadovoh, Modhusudanah

Daytaarih, Kundori Kaakshyoh, Banamaali
Bada Priyahah, Bramhaa Bishnuh, Tushmei

Bangshyo, Muraarih Krushna Kesavah
Sri Rama, Sachhidaanandoh,

Gobindah Poromesworoh
Bishnur Bishnur, Moha Bishnur,

Pravah Bishnur Maheswarahha
Loka Kartaa, Jagannatho,
Mahih Kartaah Mahajataahh… ॥

Maharshihi Kapilaachar Vyoh,
Loka Chaarih Suro Harihh

Vaatmaa Cha Jiba Paalascha,
Suraah Sangsaarah Paalakah
Eko Meko Mama Priyo.. ॥

Bramahah Baadi Maheswarahha
Dui Bhujo Scho Chatur Baahu,

Sata Baahu Sahastrahah
Padma Patra Bishalakshya

Padma Garva Paro Hari
Padma Hastoh, Deva Paalo

Daitaari Daitanasanaha
Chaturr Murti, Chaturr Baahu
Schaturr Naa Nana Sevitoh…

Padma Hastoh, Chakra Paani
Sankha Hastoh, Gadaadharah

Maha Baikunthabasi Cho
Laxmi Priti Karah Sadaa ।
aartis.desc: The Shri Jagannath Aarti is a beautiful devotional song dedicated to Lord Jagannath, the supreme ruler of the universe. Chaturbhuja Jagannatha is a powerful and majestic form of the Lord, with four arms and a lotus in each hand. The aarti describes the Lord's many qualities and His infinite power and mercy. It is a very moving and devotional song that will fill your heart with love and devotion for the Lord.
aartis.title: Shri Jagannath Aarti - Chaturbhuja Jagannatha

aartis.content:
Anant Roop Annant Naam
Anant Roop Annant Naam,
Anant Roop Annant Naam,
Aadhee Moola Narayana
Aadhee Moola Narayana
Anant Roop Annant Naam,
Anant Roop Annant Naam,
Aadhi Moola Narayana
Aadhi Moola Narayana

Viswa Roopa Viswa Dhara
Viswa Roopa Viswa Dhara
Viswavyapaka Narayana
Viswavyapaka Narayana
Viswa Tejasa Pragya Swaroopa
Viswa Tejasa Pragya Swaroopa

Hey Dhaya Sindho Krshna Hey Dhaya
Ananta Sayana Hey Jaganatha
Ananta Sayana Hey Jaganatha
Kamala Nayana Hey Madhava
Kamala Nayana Hey Madhava
Karuna Sagara Kaliya Nardhana
Karuna Sagara Kaliya Nardhana

Hey Daya Sindho Krshna
Hey Daya Sindho Krshna
Hey Krpa Sindho Krshna
Hey Krpa Sindho Krshna

Anant Roop Annant Naam,
Anant Roop Annant Naam,
Aadhi Moola Narayana
Aadhi Moola Narayana
aartis.desc: The Shri Jagganath Sandhya Aarti is a beautiful and sacred ritual performed in honor of Lord Jagganath, the supreme deity of the Hindu faith. This aarti is performed every evening as the sun sets, and is a beautiful sight to behold. The aarti begins with the lighting of oil lamps and the chanting of sacred mantras, followed by the offering of flowers and incense to the deity. The entire ritual is performed with great reverence and devotion, and is a truly beautiful experience.
aartis.title: Shri Jagganath Sandhya Aarti

aartis.content:
Om Jai Janakinatha,
Jai Shri Raghunatha ।
Dou Kar Joren Binvaun,
Prabhu! Suniye Baata ॥
Tum Raghunath Hamare,
Pran Pita Mata ।
Tum Hi Sajjan-sangee,
Bhakti Mukti Data ॥

Lakh Chaurasi Kato,
Meto Yam Trasa ।
Nishadin Prabhu Mohi Rakhiye,
Apane Hi Pasa ॥

Ram Bharat Lachhiman,
Sang Shatruhan Bhaiya ।
Jagamag Jyoti Virajai,
Shobha Ati Lahiya ॥

Hanumat Naad Bajavat,
Nevar Jhamakata ।
Svarnathal Kar Arti,
Karat Kaushalya Mata ॥

Subhag Mukut Sar, Dhanu Sar,
Kar Shobha Bhari ।
Maniram Darshan Kari,
Pal-Pal Balihari ॥

Jai Janakinatha,
Ho Prabhu Jai Shri Raghunatha ।
Ho Prabhu Jai Sita Mata,
Ho Prabhu Jai Lakshman Bhrata ॥

Ho Prabhu Jai Chaaraun Bhrata,
Ho Prabhu Jai Hanumat Dasa ।
Dou Kar Jode Vinavaun,
Prabhu Meri Suno Bata ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Jankinatha Aarti is a beautiful and sacred prayer that is sung in honor of Lord Jankinatha, the supreme lord of the universe. This aarti is sung with great devotion and love by devotees all over the world, and it is truly a beautiful way to worship the lord. The words of the aarti are very powerful and touch the heart, and the music is absolutely divine. The Shri Jankinatha Aarti is definitely a must-hear for all devotees of Lord Jankinatha.
aartis.title: Shri Jankinatha Ji Aarti

aartis.content:
Om Jai Doolah Deva,
Sain Jai Doolah Deva ।
Pooja Kani Tha Premi,
Siduk Rakhi Seva ॥

Tuhinje Dar De Kei,
Sajan Achani Savali ।
Daan Vathan Sabhu Dili,
San Kon Dithubh Khali ॥
॥ Om Jai Doolah Deva...॥

Andhadani Khe Dinav,
Akhadiyon-Dukhiyani Khe Darun ।
Paye Man Jun Muradun,
Sevak Kani Tharoo ॥
॥ Om Jai Doolah Deva...॥

Phal Phoola Meva Sabjiu,
Pokhani Manjhi Pachin ।
Tuhije Mahir Mayasa Anna,
Bi Aapar Apar Thiyani ॥
॥ Om Jai Doolah Deva...॥

Jyoti Jage Thi Jagu Mein,
Laal Tuhinjee Lali ।
Amarlal Achu Moo Vati,
He Vishwa Sanda Vali ॥
॥ Om Jai Doolah Deva...॥

Jagu Ja Jeev Sabhei,
Pania Bin Pyaas ।
Jethanand Aanand Kar,
Pooran Kariyo Aasha ॥

Om Jai Doolah Deva,
Sain Jai Doolah Deva ।
Pooja Kani Tha Premi,
Siduk Rakhi Seva ॥
aartis.desc: Jhulelal is the name of the chief deity of the Sindhis. He is also known as Doolah Deva and is worshipped in the form of a snake. The aarti is a devotional song sung in praise of Jhulelal. It is typically sung at the end of a puja (worship) ceremony. The lyrics of the aarti praise the deity for his power and beneficence. They also express a desire for his blessings. The aarti is a popular devotional song among Sindhis and is often sung on special occasions such as weddings and festivals.
aartis.title: Shri Jhulelal Om Jai Doolah Deva

aartis.content:
Jai Kuber Swami,
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami,
Hai Samrath Paripuran ।
Hai Samrath Paripuran ।
Hai Antaryami ॥
Om Jai Kuber Swami
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..
Jai Kuber Swami,
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami,
Hai Samrath Paripuran ।
Hai Antaryami ।
॥ Om Jai Kuber Swami.. ॥
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..

Vishrava Ke Laal Idvida Ke Pyare,
Maa Idvida Ke Pyare,
Kaveri Ke Nath Ho ।
Shivji Ke Dulare ।
॥ Om Jai Kuber Swami.. ॥
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..

Manigravi Minaakshi Devi,
Nalkuber Ke Taat,
Prabhu Nalkuber Ke Taat
Devlok Mein Jaagrt ।
Aap Hi Ho Sakshat ।
॥ Om Jai Kuber Swami.. ॥
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..

Reva Narmada Tat
Shobha Atibhari
Prabhu Shobha Atibhari
Karnali Mein Virajat ।
Bhole Bhandaari ।
॥ Om Jai Kuber Swami.. ॥
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..

Vandhya Putr Ratan Aur
Nirdhan Dhan Paye
Sab Nirdhan Dhan Paye
Manvanchhit Phal Dete ।
Jo Man Se Dhyaye ।
॥ Om Jai Kuber Swami.. ॥
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..

Sakal Jagat Mein Tum Hi
Sab Ke Sukhdata
Prabhu Sab Ke Sukhdata
Daas Jaiant Kar Vande
Jaaye Balihari ।
॥ Om Jai Kuber Swami.. ॥
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..

Jai Kuber Swami,
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami,
Hai Samarath Paripuran ।
Hai Samarath Paripuran ।
Hai Antaryami ॥
Om Jai Kuber Swami
Prabhu Jai Kuber Swami..
aartis.desc: Shri Kuber Aarti is a popular aarti (hymn) sung in praise of Lord Kuber, the Hindu god of wealth. Jai Kuber Swami is another name for Lord Kuber. The aarti begins with the words "Jai Kuber Swami" and goes on to extol the Lord's virtues. It describes him as the giver of wealth and prosperity, and as the protector of his devotees. The aarti is a beautiful expression of devotion to Lord Kuber, and is sure to please him. It is sung with great feeling and devotion, and is sure to bring blessings from the Lord.
aartis.title: Shri Kuber Aarti, Jai Kuber Swami

aartis.content:
Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare,
Swami Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare।
Sharan Pade Bhagato Ke,
Bhandar kuber Bhare॥
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Shiv Bhakto Me Bhakt Kuber Bade,
Swami Bhakta Kuber Bade ।
Daitya Danav Manav Se,
Kai-Kai Yuddh Lade ॥
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Swarn Sinhasan Baithe,
Sir Par Chhatra Phire,
Swami Sir Par Chhatra Phire ।
Yogini Mangal Gavain,
Sab Jai Jai Kar Karain ॥
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Gada Trishul Hath Me,
Shastra Bahut Dhare,
Swami Shastra Bahut Dhare ।
Sukh Bhay Sankat Mochan,
Dhanush Tankar Bhare ॥
॥Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Bhanti Bhanti Ke Vyanjan Bahut Bane,
Swami Vyanjan Bahut Bane ।
Mohan Bhog Lagavain,
Sath Me Urad Chane ॥
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Bal Buddhi Vidya Data,
Ham Teri Sharan Pade,
Swami Ham Teri Sharan Pade|
Apane Bhakt Jano Ke,
Sare Kam Sanvare ॥
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Mukut Mani Ki Shobhaa,
Motiyan Haar Gale,
Swami Motiyan Haar Gale ।
Agar Kapur Ki Baati,
Ghee Ki Jot Jale ॥
॥Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Yaksha Kuber Ki AAarti Jo Koi Nar Gaave,
Swami Jo Koi Nar Gaave ।
Kahat Prempaal Swami,
Manavaanchhit Phal Paave ।
॥Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Mukut Mani Ki Shobha,
Motiyan Haar Gale,
Swami Motiyan Haar Gale ।
Agar Kapur Ki Bati,
Ghee Ki Jot Jale ॥
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

Yaksha Kuber Ki Aarti,
Jo Koi Nar Gave,
Swami Jo Koi Nar Gave ।
Kahat Prempal Swami,
Manavanchhit Phal Pave ।
॥ Om Jai Yaksh Kuber Hare...॥

॥ Eti Shri Kuber Aarti ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Kuber Aarti is a very popular aarti amongst Hindus. It is sung in praise of Kuber, the god of wealth and prosperity. The aarti is sung in a very beautiful and melodious way, and is very popular amongst devotees of Kuber. The lyrics of the aarti are very meaningful and invoke the blessings of Kuber for prosperity and abundance.
aartis.title: Shri Kuber Aarti Yaksh Kuber

aartis.content:
Shri Mateshwari Jai Tripureswari ।
Rajeshwari Jai Namo Namah ॥

Karunamayi Sakal Agh Harini ।
Amrt Varshini Namo Namah ॥

Jay Sharanan Varanan Namo Namah ।
Shri Mateshwari Jai Tripureswari ॥

Ashubh Vinashini, Sab Sukh Dayini ।
Khal-dal Nashini Namo Namah ॥

Bhandasur Vadhkarini Jai Maa ।
Karuna Kalite Namo Namah ॥

Jai Sharanan Varanan Namo Namah ।
Shri Mateshwari Jai Tripureswari ॥

Bhav Bhay Harini, Kasht Nivarini ।
Sharan Gati Do Namo Namah ॥

Shiv Bhamini Saadhak Man Harini ।
Aadi Shakti Jai Namo Namah ॥

Jay Sharanan Varanan Namo Namah ।
Jay Tripur Sundari Namo Namah ॥

Shri Mateshwari Jai Tripureswari ।
Rajeshwari Jai Namo Namah ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Lalita Mata Aarti is one of the most sacred and important aartis of the Hindu religion. It is sung in honor of the Great Goddess Lalita, who is the embodiment of divine femininity. This aarti is believed to bestow upon the devotee all the blessings of Maa Lalita, including peace, prosperity, and happiness. The lyrics of the Shri Lalita Mata Aarti are filled with praise and adoration for the Goddess. They extol her beauty, her power, and her mercy. The aarti is also a prayer for Maa Lalita's guidance and protection. The Shri Lalita Mata Aarti is typically sung at dawn or dusk, when the Goddess is believed to be most present. It is also often sung during festivals and special occasions dedicated to Maa Lalita. The aarti is an important part of Hindu worship, and it is considered to be a very powerful form of prayer. Those who sing it with sincerity and devotion are sure to receive the blessings of the Great Goddess.
aartis.title: Shri Lalita Mata Ki Aarti

aartis.content:
Jai Sanmati Deva,
Prabhu Jai Sanmati Deva ।
Vardhman Mahaveer Veer Ati,
Jai Sankat Cheva ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥
Siddharath Nrap Nand Dulare,
Trishala Ke Jaye
Kundalpur Avatar Liya,
Prabhu Surnar Harshaye ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

Dev Indra JanmaBhishek Kar,
Ur Pramod Bhariya
Roop Aapaka Lakh Nahi Payen
Sahas Aankh Dhariya ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

Jal Mein Bhinn Kamal Jo Rahiye,
Ghar Mein Baal Yati
Rajpat Aishwarya Chod Sab,
Mamata Moh Hati ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

Bharah Varsh Jhadmavastha Main,
Aatma Dhyaan Kiya
Ghati Karm Choor Choor,
Prabhu Keval Gyaan Liya ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

Pavapur Ke Bheech Sarovar,
Aakar Yog Kase
Hane Aghatiya Karm Shtru Sab,
Shivpur Jaye Base ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

Bhomandal Ke Chandanpur Main,
Mandir Madhya Lase
Shant Jineshwar Murti Aapaki,
Darshan Paap Nase ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

KarunaSagar Karuna Keeje,
Aakar Sharan Gahi
DeenDayala JagPratipala,
Anand Bharan Tu Hi ॥
॥ Om Jai Sanmati Deva...॥

Jai Sanmati Deva,
Prabhu Jai Sanmati Deva ।
Vardhman Mahaveer Veer Ati,
Jai Sankat Cheva ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Mahaveer Bhagwan aarti is one of the most beautiful and popular aartis among Hindus. It is sung in devotion to Lord Mahaveer, the 24th and last Tirthankara of Jainism. The aarti is sung in praise of Lord Mahaveer's qualities of truth, knowledge and bliss. The aarti also describes Lord Mahaveer as the destroyer of all sorrows and the giver of happiness and peace.
aartis.title: Shri Mahaveer Bhagwan Jai Sanmati Deva

aartis.content:
Jai Gorakh Yogi (Shri Guru Ji) Har Har Gorakh Yogi ।
Ved Puran Bakhanat, Brahmadik Surmaanat, Atal Bhawan Yogi ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥
Baal Jati Brahmgyani Yog Yukti Poore (Shriguruji) Yog Yukti Poore ।
Sohan Shabd Nirantar (Anhad Naad Nirantar) Baaj Rahe Toore ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Ratnjadit Mani Manik Kundal Kanan Mein (Shri Guruji) Kundal Kanan Mein
Jata Mukut Sir Sohat Man Mohat Bhasmanti Tan Mein ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Aadi Purush Avinashi, Nirgun Gunrashi (Shri Guruji) Nirgun Gunrashi,
Sumiran Se Agh Chhute, Sumiran Se Paap Chhute, Tute Yam Phaansi ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Dhyan Kiyo Dashrath Sut Raghukul Vanshmani (Shri Guruji) Raghukul Vanshmani,
Sita Shok Nivarak, Sita Mukt Karai, Maaryo Lank Dhani ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Nandnandan Jagvandan, Girdhar Vanmali, (Shri Guruji) Girdhar Vanmali
Nish Vassar Gun Gavat, Vanshi Madhur Vajavat, Sang Rukmani Baali ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Dhara Nagar Mainawati Tumharo Dhyandhare (Shri Guruji) Tumharo Dhyaan Dhare
Amar Kiye Gopichand, Amar Kiye Poornmal, Sankat Door Kare ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Chandraval Lakhraval Nijkar Ghatmari, (Shri Guruji) Nijkar Ghaatmari,
Yog Amar Phal Dekar, 2 Kshan Mein Amar Kari ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Bhoop Amit Sharanagat Jankadik Gyani, (Shri Guruji)jankadik Gyani
Maan Dilip Yudhishthir 2 Harishchandr Se Daani ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Veer Dheer Sang Riddhi Siddhi Ganpati Chanvar Kare (Shri Guruji) Ganapati Chanvar Kare
Jagdamba Jagjanani 2 Yogini Dhyan Dhare ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Daya Kari Chaurang Par Kathin Vipatitari (Shri Guruji) Kathin Vipatitari
Deendayal Dayanidhi 2 Sevak Sukhakari ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥

Itni Shri Nath Ji Ki Mangal Aarti Nishdin Jo Gaave (Shri Guruji)
Praat Samay Gaave, Bhanat Vichar Pad (Bhartruhari Bhoop Amar Pad)so Nishchay Paave ।
Omm Jai Gorakh Yogi ॥
aartis.desc: The Gorakhnath Math is a religious institution located in the city of Gorakhpur in Uttar Pradesh, India. The Math is dedicated to the memory of the saint Gorakhnath, who was a renowned Hindu yogi and philosopher. The Math conducts regular religious ceremonies and aartis (worship rituals) in honor of Gorakhnath. The Shri Nathji Mangal Aarti is one of the most important aartis conducted at the Math. It is held every day at dawn, and involves the chanting of mantras and the offering of flowers and incense to the deity.
aartis.title: Shri Nathji Mangal Aarti - Gorakhnath Math

aartis.content:
Shri Guru Gorakshnath Ji Ki Sandhya Aarti
Omm Guruji Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva । Shri Avdhu Har Har Goraksh Deva ।
Sur Nar Muni Jan Dhyavat, Sur Nar Muni Jan Sevat ।
Siddh Karain Sab Seva, Shri Avdhu Sant Karain Sab Seva ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥
Omm Guruji Yog Yugti Kar Jaanat Maanat Brahm Gyani ।
Shri Avdhu Maanat Sarv Gyaani ।
Siddh Shiromani Rajat Sant Shiromani Sajat ।
Goraksh Gun Gyani, Shri Avdhu Goraksh Sarv Gyani ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guruji Gyan Dhyan Ke Daari Guru Sab Ke Ho Hitkari ।
Shri Avdhu Sab Ke Ho Sukhkaari ।
Go Indriyon Ke Rakshak Sarv Indriyon Ke Palak ।
Rakhat Sudh Saari, Shri Avdhu Raakhat Sudh Saari ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guru Ji Ramate Shriraam Sakal Yug Maahi Chhaya Hai Naahin ।
Shri Avdhu Maya Hai Nahin ।
Ghat Ghat Ke Goraksh Vyapai Sarv Ghat Shri Nath Ji Virajat ।
So Laksh Man Maanhi Shri Avdhu So Laksh Dil Maanhi ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guruji Bhasmi Guru Lasat Sarjani Hai Ange ।
Shri Avdhu Janani Hai Sange ।
Ved Uchchare So Jaanat Yog Vichare So Maanat ।
Yogi Guru Bahurangaa Shri Avdhu Bole Goraksh Sarv Sanga ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guru Ji Kanth Viraajat Seli Aur Shrrngi Jat Mat Sukhi Beli ।
Shri Avdhu Jat Sat Sukh Beli ।
Bhagava Kantha Sohat-geruva Anchala Sohat Gyan Ratan Thaili ।
Shri Avdhu Yog Yugati Jholi ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guru Ji Kaanon Mein Kundal Raajat Saajat Ravi Chandrama ।
Shri Avdhu Sohat Mastak Chandrama ।
Baajat Shringi Naada-guru Bajat Anahad Naada-guru Bhaajat Duhkh Dwanda ।
Shri Avdhu Naashat Sarv Sanshay
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guru Ji Nidra Maaro Guru Kaal Sanhaaro-sankat Ke Ho Bairi
Shri Avdhu Dushtan Ke Ho Bairi
Karo Kripa Santan Par-guru Daya Paalo Bhaktan Par Sharanagat Tumhari
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥

Omm Guru Ji Itni Shrinath Ji Ki Sandhya Aarti
Nish Din Jo Gave-shri Avdhu Sarv Din Rat Gave
Varni Raja Ramchandra Swami Guru Jape Raja Ramchandr Yogi
Manvanchhit Phal Paave Shri Avdhu Sukh Sampatti Phal Paave ।
Shiv Jai Jai Goraksh Deva ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Nathji Sandhya Aarti is a beautiful and sacred ritual performed every evening at the Gorakhnath Math in India. This devotional practice honors Shri Nathji, an incarnation of Lord Krishna, and is a deeply moving and spiritual experience for all who participate. The aarti begins with the lighting of a lamp, and the singing of devotional songs and prayers. The participants then circumambulate Shri Nathji three times, and offer flowers and incense to him. The aarti concludes with the lighting of a large fire in which everyone participates. The Shri Nathji Sandhya Aarti is a beautiful way to connect with the divine and to experience the peace and love of the Lord. It is a deeply moving and sacred ritual that is cherished by all who participate.
aartis.title: Shri Nathji Sandhya Aarti - Gorakhnath Math

aartis.content:
Aarti Sri Navagrahao Ki Kijai.
Baadh, Kasth, Roag, Har Leeje.

Surya Tej Vyaape Jeewan Bhar.
Jaaki Kripa Kabhut Nahi Cheejhe.

Rup Chandra Sheetalta Laaye.
Shanti Sneh Saras Rasu Bhijai.

Mangal Hare Amangal Sara.
Saumya Sudha Ras Pijai.

Buddha Sadha Vaibhav Yash Liiye.
Sukh Sampathi Lakshmi Pacizai.

Vidya Budhi Gyaan Guru Se Le Lo.
Pragati Sdda Maanav Pai Reejhe.

Shukra Tark Vigyaan Bdaave.
Desh Dharma Seva Yash Lije.

Nyaiedish Shani Ati Pyaare.
Jap Tap Shrdha Shani Ko Diijai.

Rahu Mann Ka Bharam Hraave.
Saath Na Kabhu Kukarm Na Deejai.

Swasth Uttam Ketu Raakhe.
Pradhinta Mannhith Kheeje.
aartis.desc: The nine Navgrahs, or planets, are an integral part of Hindu cosmology and are believed to influence all aspects of human life. The Navgrah Aarti is a prayer to these nine planets, seeking their blessings and protection. The Navgrah Aarti is traditionally performed twice daily, at dawn and dusk. It is a simple but powerful ritual that anyone can perform, regardless of religious affiliation. The Aarti consists of nine rounds of chanting and waving a lighted lamp or incense before each planet. The Navgrah Aarti is a beautiful way to connect with the energies of the nine planets and invoke their blessings in our lives. It is a reminder that we are all connected, and that the planets are powerful allies in our journey through life.
aartis.title: Shri Navgrah Ji Aarti

aartis.content:
Aarti Shri Ramayan Ji Ki ।
Kirti Kalit Lalit Siya Pi Ki ॥
Gavat Brahmadik Muni Narad ।
Valmiki Vigyan Visharad ॥
Shuk Sanakadi Shesh Aru Sarad ।
Barni Pavansut Kirti Niki ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Ramayan Ji Ki..॥

Gavat Ved Puran Ashtdash ।
Chhahon Shastra Sab Granthan Ko Ras॥
Munijan Dhan Santan Ko Sarbas ।
Sar Ansh Sammat Sab-hiki ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Ramayan Ji Ki..॥

Gavat Santat Shambhu Bhavani ।
Aru Ghatsambhav Muni Vigyani ॥
Vyas Adi Kavibarj Bakhani ।
Kakbhushundi Garur Ke Hi Ki ॥
॥ Aarti Shri Ramayan Ji Ki..॥

Kalimal Harni Vishay Ras Phiki ।
Subhag Singar Mukti Juvati Ki ॥
Dalan Rog Bhav Muri Ami Ki ।
Tat Mat Sab Vidhi Tulsi Ki ॥

Aarti Shri Ramayan Ji Ki ।
Kirti Kalit Lalit Siya Pi Ki ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Ramayan Aarti is a beautiful and sacred prayer that is recited to honor the great Hindu deity, Lord Ram. This aarti is typically sung at the end of a puja or religious ceremony, and it is believed to bring peace and blessings to those who recite it. The words of the aarti are incredibly powerful, and they offer praise and thanksgiving to Lord Ram for his many blessings. The melody of the aarti is also very beautiful, and it is sure to touch the hearts of those who hear it.
aartis.title: Shri Ramayan Aarti

aartis.content:
Aarti Kije Shri Ramchandra Ki।
Dushtdalan Sitapati Ji Ki॥

Pahali Aarti Pushpan Ki Maala।
Kaali Naag Naath।aaye Gopala॥

Dusari Aarti Devaki Nandan।
Bhakt Ubaaran Kans Nikandan॥

Tisari Aarti Tribhuvan Mohe।
Ratna Sinhaasan Sita Ram Ji Sohe॥

Chauthi Aarti Chahu Yug Puja।
Dev Niranjan Svaami Aur Na Duja॥

Paanchavi Aarti Ram Ko Bhaave।
Ramji Kaa Yash Namadevaji Gave॥
aartis.desc: Shri Ramchandra aarti is a devotional song dedicated to Lord Ram, the seventh avatar of Lord Vishnu. It is sung in praise of his virtues and greatness. The lyrics of the aarti describe Lord Ram as the embodiment of truth, justice and righteousness. They extol his heroic deeds and invoke his blessings for peace, prosperity and happiness. The aarti is sung with great devotion and fervour by devotees all over the world. It is believed that chanting the aarti with sincerity and dedication can lead to the fulfilment of all desires. The aarti is a beautiful expression of the devotional love and reverence that devotees feel for Lord Ram.
aartis.title: Shri Ramchandra Aarti

aartis.content:
Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ।
Apne Bhakt Janan Ki,
Door Karan Vipada ॥
Avani Anantar Jyoti Akhandit,
Mandit Chahunk Kumbha ।
Durjan Dalan Khadg ki,
Vidhut Sam Pratibha ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ॥

Markat Mani Mandir Ati Manjul,
Shobha Lakhi Na Pare ।
Lalit Dhvaja Chahun Aure,
Kanchan Kalash Dhare ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ॥

Ghanta Ghanan Ghadaval Baje,
Shankh Mridang Dhure ।
Kinnar Gayan Karte,
Ved Dhwani Uchare ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ॥

Sapta Matrika Kare Aarti,
Surgan Dhyan Dhare ।
Vividh Prakar Ke Vyanjan,
Sriphal Bhentha Dhare ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ॥

Sankat Vikat Vidarani,
Nashani Ho Komati ।
Sevak Jan Hriday Patale,
Mridul Karan Sumati ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ॥

Amal Kamal Dal Lochani,
Mochani Traya Tapa ।
Sevan Aayo Sharan Aapki,
Laaj Rakho Mata ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ॥

Ya Miyaji Ki Aarti pratidin,
Parti Din Jo Koi Gata ।
Sadan Siddhi Nav Nidhiphal,
Mann Vancchit Paave ॥

Om Jai Sri Ranisatiji Mata,
Maiya Jai Rani Sati Mata ।
Apne Bhakt Janan Ki,
Door Karan Vipada ॥
aartis.desc: The Aarti of Shri Rani Sati Dadi Ji is a beautiful and sacred ritual that is performed in honor of the divine Mother. This Aarti is sung in praise of Dadi Ji, who is an incarnation of the Goddess Durga. The words of the Aarti express the deep love and reverence that we have for our Mother. The Aarti is sung with great devotion and feeling, and the devotees join together in singing the praises of Dadi Ji. The Aarti is a very powerful and moving experience, and it is a great privilege to be able to participate in it.
aartis.title: Shri Rani Sati Dadi Ji

aartis.content:
Jai Lakshmi Ramna, Swami Jai Lakshmi Ramna।
Satyanarayan Swami, Jan Paatak Harna॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥
Ratan Jadhit Sinhaasan, Adbhut Chavi Raaje।
Naarad Karat Niraajan, Ghanta Van Baaje॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Prakat Bhay Kalikaaran, Dwij Ko Daras Diyo।
Budho Bramhaan Bankar, Kanchan Mahal Kiyo॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Durbal Bheel Kathoro, Jin Par Kripa Kari।
Chandrachud Ek Raaja, Tinki Vipatti Hari॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Vaishya Manorath Paayo, Shradha Taj Dinhi।
So Fal Bhagyo Prabhuji, Fir Stutui Kinhi॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Bhav Bhakti Ke Kaaran, Chin Chin Rup Dhrayo।
Shradha Dhaaran Kinhi, Tinko Kaaj Saro॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Gwaaal- Baal Sang Raja, Ban Me Bhakti Kari।
Manvaanchit Phal Dinho, Deen Dayalu Hari॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Chadat Prasad Savaayo Kadali Fal Meva।
Dhup Deep Tulsi Se Raaji Satyadeva॥
॥Om Jai Lakshmi Ramna...॥

Shri Satyanarayan Ji Ki Aarti Jo Koi Gaave।
Riddhi-Siddhi Sukh-Sampati Sahaj Roop Pave॥

Jai Lakshmi Ramna, Swami Jai Lakshmi Ramna।
Satyanarayan Swami, Jan Paatak Harna॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Satyanarayan aarti is a very sacred and important part of Hindu worship. It is performed in order to worship the supreme god, Shri Satyanarayan. The aarti is a very beautiful and moving ceremony, and it is said to bring peace and happiness to those who participate in it. It is a very special and significant part of Hindu culture, and it is an experience that everyone should have at least once in their lifetime.
aartis.title: Shri Satyanarayan Ji Ki Aarti

aartis.content:
Varna Varna Ke Pushpa Chadhaun.
Shaligram Suno Vinati Meri.

Pratah Samay Uthi Manjan Karke.
Prem Sahit Sanaan Karau.

Chandan Dhoop Deep Tulsidal.
Varan Varan Ke Pusp Chdaoo.

Tumhre Saamne Nritya Karu Nit.
Prabhu Ghanta Sankh Mridang Bajaoon.

Charan Dhoy Charnamrit Lekar.
Kutumb Sahit Bakunath Sindaaru.

Jo Kuch Rukha Sukha Ghar Me.
Bhog Lagakar Bhojan Paaoon.

Mann Vrachan Karm Se Paap Kiye.
Jo Parikarma Ke Sath Bahaau.

Aisi Kripa Karo Mujh Par.
Jam Ke Dwaare Jaane Na Paau.

Madhavdas Ki Vinti Yahi Hai.
Hari Daasan Ko Daas Khaau.
aartis.desc: Shri Shaligram is a sacred stone that is revered by Hindus. It is believed to be a manifestation of Lord Vishnu, and is often used in puja rituals and worship. The aarti, or devotional song, dedicated to Shri Shaligram is a beautiful expression of devotion and love. The lyrics extol the many virtues of the stone, and express a deep desire to be in its presence. The music is peaceful and calming, creating a sense of reverence and peace. The aarti is a beautiful way to connect with the divine, and to express our love and devotion to Lord Vishnu.
aartis.title: Shri Shaligram Ji Aarti

aartis.content:
Aarti Keejai Narasinh Kunvar Ki ।
Ved Vimal Yash Gaun Mere Prabhuji ॥
Pahali Aarti Prahlad Ubare ।
Hiranakush Nakh Udar Vidare ॥

Dusari Aarti Vaaman Seva ।
Bal Ke Dware Padhare Hari Deva ॥

Teesari Aarti Brahm Padhare ।
Sahasabahu Ke Bhuja Ukhare ॥

Chauthi Aarti Asur Sanhare ।
Bhakt Vibhishan Lank Padhare ॥

Panchavin Aarti Kans Pachhare ।
Gopi Gwal Sakha Pratipale ॥

Tulasi Ko Patr Kanth Mani Heera ॥
Harashi-Nirakhi Gave Das Kabira ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Shani Dev is one of the most revered deities in Hinduism. His aarti is chanted by devotees all over the world to seek his blessings. The aarti is a beautiful hymn which praising Shri Shani Dev for his power and benevolence. The aarti is said to bring good luck and fortune to those who chant it with sincerity.
aartis.title: Shri Shani Dev Aarti Keejai Narasinh Kunwar Ki

aartis.content:
Jai Jai Shri Shani Dev Bhaktan Hitkari ।
Suraj Ke Putra Prabhu Chaya Mehatari ॥
॥ Jai Jai Shri Shani..॥
Shyam Ank Vakra Drisht Chaturbhurja Dhari ।
Nilamber Dhar Nath Gaj Ki Aswari ॥
॥ Jai Jai Shri Shani..॥

Krit Mukut Sheesh Sahej Dipat Hain Lilari ।
Muktan Ki Mala Gale Shobhit Balihari ॥
॥ Jai Jai Shri Shani..॥

Modak Mishtaan Pan Chadhat Hain Supari ।
Loha, Til, Urad Mahishi Ati Pyari ॥
॥ Jai Jai Shri Shani..॥

Dev Danuj Rishi Muni Surat Nar Nari ।
Vishwanath Dharat Dhayan Sharan Hain Tumhari ॥
॥ Jai Jai Shri Shani..॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Shani Dev Ji Aarti is a beautiful devotional song that is sung in praise of Lord Shani, the god of justice. The lyrics of the song describe Lord Shani's qualities and recount his deeds. The song is a reminder to us that Lord Shani is always watching over us and guiding us on the path of righteousness. The Shri Shani Dev Ji Aarti is an important part of the worship of Lord Shani and is a wonderful way to show our devotion to him.
aartis.title: Shri Shani Dev Ji

aartis.content:
Jai Devi Jai Devi Jai Shante Janani ।
Durga Bahudakhdane Ratlo Tav Bhajani ॥
Bhukailasa Aisi Hi Kavla Nagri ।
Shantadurga Tethe Bhaktabhahari ।
Asurat Mardiya Survarkaivari ।
Smriti Vidhiharishankar Surgana Antari ।

Jai Devi Jai Devi Jai Shante Janani ।
Durge Bahudukkhadne Ratlo Tav Bhajani ॥

Prabodh Tujha Nawhe Bishwabhitri ।
Neti Neti Shabde Garjati Pay Chari ।
Sahi Shastra Mathita Na Kathishi Nirdhari ।
Ashtadash Gargti Pari Nenti tav thori ।

Jai Devi Jai Devi Jai Shante Janani ।
Durge Bahudukkhadne Ratlo Tav Bhajani ॥

Koti madan Rupa Asi Mukhsobha ।
Sarvangi Bhushane Jambundgabha ।
Nasagri Muktaftha Dinamanichi Prabha ।
Bhaktjanate Abhay Desi Tu Amba ।

Jai Devi Jai Devi Jai Shante Janani ।
Durge Bahudukkhadne Ratlo Tav Bhajani ॥

Ambe Bhaktansathi Hosi Sakar ।
Natri Jagjeevan Tu Nawhasi Gochar ।
Viratrupa Dharuni Karisi Byapar ।
Triguni Virheet Sahit Tuj Kacha Paar ।

Jai Devi Jai Devi Jai Shante Janani ।
Durge Bahudukkhadne Ratlo Tav Bhajani ॥

Tritapatape Shramlo Nijvi Nijsadani ।
Ambe Sakrambhe Raka Sashivadini ।
Agame Nigme Durga Bhaktanche Janani ।
Padmaji Babaji Ramla Tav Bhajani ।

Jai Devi Jai Devi Jai Shante Janani ।
Durge Bahudukkhadne Ratlo Tav Bhajani ॥
aartis.desc: Shri Shanta Durgechi Aarti is a very beautiful and sacred aarti. It is sung in praise of Goddess Shanta Durge, who is the goddess of peace and happiness. This aarti is very popular among the devotees of Goddess Shanta Durge. The lyrics of this aarti are very powerful and touching. They express the deep devotion and love of the devotees for their goddess. This aarti is sure to fill your heart with peace and happiness.
aartis.title: Shri Shanta Durgechi Aarti

aartis.content:
Sukh Karta Dukhharta Varta Vighnachi ।
Noorvi Poorvi Prem Krupya Jayachi ।
Sarwangi Sundar Utishendu Rachi ।
Kanthi Jhalke Maad Mukhta Padhanchi ।
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Mangal Murti ।
Darshan Matre Mann,
Kamana Purti
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Ratnakhachit Phara Tujh Gaurikumra ।
Chandanaachi Uti Kumkum Ke Shara ।
Hire Jadit Mukut Shobhato Bara ।
Runjhunati Nupure Charani Ghagriya ।
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Mangal Murti ।
Darshan Matre Mann,
Kamana Purti
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Lambodar Pitaambar Phanivar Vandana ।
Saral Sond Vakratunda Trinayana ।
Das Ramacha Vat Pahe Sadna ।
Sankati Pavave Nirvani Rakshave Survar Vandana ।
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Mangal Murti ।
Darshan Matre Mann,
Kamana Purti
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

॥ Shri Ganeshaachi Aarti ॥

Shindur Laal Chadhayo Achchha Gajmukhko ।
Dondil Laal Biraje Sut Gauriharko ।
Haath Lie Gud Laddoo Saiin Survarko ।
Mahima Kahe Na Jaay Laagat Hoon Paadko ॥
Jay Dev Jay Dev..

Jay Dev Jay Dev,
Jay Jay Shri Ganraaj ।
Vidya Sukhdaata
Dhanya Tumhara Darshan
Mera Mann Ramta,
Jay Dev Jay Dev ॥

Astau Siddhi Dasi Sankatko Bairi ।
Vighnavinaashan Mangal Moorat Adhikari ।
Kotisurajprakash Aibi Chhabi Teri ।
Gandasthalamadamastak Jhoole Shashibihari ॥
Jay Dev Jay Dev..

Jay Dev Jay Dev,
Jay Jay Shri Ganraaj ।
Vidya Sukhdaata
Dhanya Tumhara Darshan
Mera Mann Ramta,
Jay Dev Jay Dev ॥

Bhavbhagat Se Koyi Sharnagat Aave ।
Santati Sampatti Sabahi Bharpur Paave ।
Aise Tum Maharaaj Moko Ati Bhaave ।
Gosavinandan Nishidin Gun Gaave ॥
Jay Dev Jay Dev..

Jay Dev Jay Dev,
Jay Jay Shri Ganraaj ।
Vidya Sukhdaata
Dhanya Tumhara Darshan
Mera Mann Ramta,
Jay Dev Jay Dev ॥

॥ Shri Shankarachi Aarti ॥
Lavathavati Vikrala Brahmandi Mala,
Vishe Kantha Kala Trinetri Jwala
Lavanya Sundara Mastaki Bala,
Tethuniya Jala Nirmala Vahe Jhulajhula ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Shri Shankara ।
Aarti Ovalu,
Tuja Karpuragaura
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Karpuragaura Bhola Nayani Vishala,
Ardhangi Parvati Sumananchya Mala,
Vibhutiche Udhalana Shitikantha Nila,
Aisa Shankar Shobhe Umavelhala ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Shri Shankara ।
Aarti Ovalu,
Tuja Karpuragaura
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Devi Daityi Sagaramanthana Pai Kele
Tyamaji Avachita Halahala Je Uthle
Te Tva Asurapane Prashan Kele,
Nilakantha Nama Prasiddh Jhale ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Shri Shankara ।
Aarti Ovalu,
Tuja Karpuragaura
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

Vyaghrambara Phanivardharasundara Madnari,
Panchanana Manamohan Munijan Sukhkari
Shatakotiche Beej Vache Uchchari,
Raghukulatilaka Ramadasa Antari ॥
Jai Dev Jai Dev..

Jai Dev Jai Dev
Jai Shri Shankara ।
Aarti Ovalu,
Tuja Karpuragaura
Jai Dev Jai Dev ॥

॥ Shri Devichi Aarti ॥
Durge Durghat Bhari Tujvin Sansari,
Anathnathe Ambe Karuna Vistari ।
Vari Vari Janam Marante Vari,
Hari Padalo Ata Sankat Nivari ॥
Jay Devi Jay Devi..

Jay Devi Jay Devi,
Jay Mahishasurmathini ।
Survar Ishwar Varde,
Tarak Sanjivani
Jay Devi Jay Devi ॥

Tujaveen Bhuvani Pahata Tuj Aise Nahi,
Chari Shramale Parantu Na Bolve Kahin ।
Sahi Vivad Karita Padile Pravahi,
Te Tu Bhaktalagi Pavasi Lavlahi ॥
Jay Devi Jay Devi..

Jay Devi Jay Devi,
Jay Mahishasurmathini ।
Survar Ishwar Varde,
Tarak Sanjivani
Jay Devi Jay Devi ॥

Prasanna Vadane Prasanna Hosi Nijdasa,
Kleshapasuni Sodivi Todi Bhavpasha ।
Ambe Tujvachun Kon Purvil Asha,
Narhari Tallin Jhala Padpankajlesha ॥
Jay Devi Jay Devi..

Jay Devi Jay Devi,
Jay Mahishasurmathini ।
Survar Ishwar Varde,
Tarak Sanjivani
Jay Devi Jay Devi ॥

॥ Ghalin Lotangan Aarti ॥
Ghalin Lotangan Vandin Charan ।
Dolyani Pahin Rup Tujhe ।
Dev Preme Alingan Anande Pujin ।
Bhave Ovalin Mhane Nama ॥

Twamev Mata Cha Pita Twamev ।
Twamev Bandhusch Sakha Twamev ।
Twamev Vidhya Dravinam Twamev ।
Twamev Sarwam Mam Dev Dev ॥

Kayena Vacha Manasendriyenva ।
Buddhayatmna Va Prakrutiswabhavat ।
Karomi Yadhyat Sakalam Parasmai ।
Narayanayeti Samarpayami ॥

Achyutam Keshavam Ramnarayanam ।
Krushanadamodaram Vasudevam Bhaje ।
Shridharam Madhavam Gopikavallabham ।
Janaki Nayakam Ramchandra Bhaje ॥

Hare Ram Hare Ram Ram,
Ram Hare Hare ।
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna,
Krishna Krishna Hare Hare ।
aartis.desc: The Shri Siddhivinayak Aarti is a devotional song dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the elephant-headed god of wisdom and success. The aarti is sung in praise of Lord Ganesha and is a popular prayer amongst Hindus. The lyrics of the aarti praise Lord Ganesha for his many qualities and describe him as the remover of obstacles and the giver of success. The aarti is a beautiful way to worship Lord Ganesha and is often sung at religious ceremonies and festivals dedicated to the god.
aartis.title: Shri Siddhivinayak Aarti: Jai Dev Jai Dev

aartis.content:
Jai Jai Jai Ravidev,
Jai Jai Jai Ravidev ।
Rajanipati Madhaari,
Shatlad Jeevan Data ॥
Patpad Mann Madukaari,
Hey Dinmann Data ।
Jag Ke He Ravidev,
Jai Jai Jai Swadev ॥

Nabh Manda| Ke Vaani,
Jyoti Prakaashak Deva ।
Nijjan Hit Sukhraashi,
Teri Hum Sab Sevaa ॥

Karte Hai Ravi Dev,
Jai Jai Jai Ravidev ।
Kanak Badan Man Mohit,
Ruchir Prabha Pyari ॥

Nit Mandal Se Mandit,
Ajar Amar Chavidhaari ।
Hey Survar Ravidev,
Jai Jai Jai Ravidev ॥

Jai Jai Jai Ravidev,
Jai Jai Jai Ravidev ।
Rajanipati Madhaari,
Shatlad Jeevan Data ॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Surya Dev Aarti is a beautiful and powerful prayer to the Sun God. It is often sung at sunrise or sunset, and is a wonderful way to connect with the energy and divinity of the Sun. The words of the prayer are incredibly powerful, and invoke a deep sense of reverence and respect for the Sun. The melody is also very beautiful, and can easily transport one into a state of deep meditation and connection with the divine.
aartis.title: Shri Surya Dev - Jai Jai Ravidev

aartis.content:
Om Jai Kashyapa Nandana, Prabhu Jai Aditi Nandan।
Tribhuvana Timir Nikandana, Bhakt Hridaya Candan॥
॥ Om Jai Kashyapa...॥
Sapta Ashwaratha Rajit, Ekchakra Dhari।
Dukhahari, Sukhakari, Manas Malhari॥
॥ Om Jai Kashyapa...॥

Sur Muni Bhusur Vandit, Vimal Vibhavashali।
Agha-dal-Dalan Diwakar, Divya Kirana Mali॥
॥ Om Jai Kashyapa...॥

Sakala Sukarm Prasavita, Savita Subhakari।
Vishva Vilochan Mochana, Bhava-Bandhan Bhari॥
॥ Om Jai Kashyapa...॥

Kamal Samuh Vikasak, Nashak Tray Tapa।
Sevat Sahaj Rahat Ati, Manasija Santapa॥
॥ Om Jai Kashyapa...॥

Netra Vyadhi Har Suravar, Bhu-Pira Hari।
Vrishti Vimochan Santat, Parahita Vratdhari॥
॥ Om Jai Kashyapa...॥

Suryadev Karunakar, Ab Karuna Kijai।
Har Ajyan Moha Sab, Tattvagyan Dije॥

Om Jai Kashyapa Nandana, Prabhu Jai Aditi Nandan।
Tribhuvana Timir Nikandana, Bhakt Hridaya Candan॥
aartis.desc: The Shri Surya Dev Aarti is a devotional song dedicated to the Hindu sun god, Surya. It is believed to have been composed by the sage Kashyapa, and is sung in praise of Surya's power and glory. The aarti is traditionally performed at sunrise, and is said to bring good luck and blessings to those who recite it.
aartis.title: Shri Surya Dev Jai Kashyapa Nandana

aartis.content:
Om Jai Surya Bhagwan, Jai Ho Dinkar Bhagwan।
Jagat Ke Netra Swaroopa, Tum Ho Triguna Swaroopa।
Dharat Saba Hi Tab Dhyan, Om Jai Surya Bhagwan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥
Sarathi Arun Hai Prabhu Tum, Shwet Kamaladhari। Tum Char Bhuja Dhari॥
Ashwa Hai Sath Tumharey, Koti Kirana Pasarey। Tum Ho Dev Mahan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥

Usha Kal Mein Jab Tum, Udayachal Aate। Sab Tab Darshan Patey॥
Phailatey Ujiyara, Jagata Tab Jag Sara। Karke Sab Tab Gungan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥

Sandhya Mein Bhuvaneshvar, Astachal Jate। Godhan Tab Ghar Aate॥
Godhuli Bela Mein, Har Ghar Har Angan Main। Ho Tav Mahima Gaan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥

Dev Danuj Nar Naari, Rishi Munivar Bhajate। Aditya Hriday Japate॥
Strot Ye Mangalakari, Isaki Hai Rachana Nyari। De Nav Jeevanadan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥

Tum Ho Trikal Rachiyata, Tum Jag Ke Adhar। Mahima Tab Aparampar॥
Pranon Ka Sinchan Karake, Bhakton Ko Apane Dete। Bal Braddhi Aur Gyan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥


Bhoochar Jalchar Khechar, Sab Ke Ho Pran Tumhi। Sab Jeevo Ke Pran Tumhi॥
Ved Puran Bhakhane, Dharm Sabhi Tumhen Maney। Tum Hi Sarv Shaktiman॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥

Pujan Karti Dishayein, Pujey Sabdikpal। Tum Bhuvno Ke Pratipal॥
Rituyain Tumhari Dasi, Tum Shashta Avinashi। Shubhkari Anshuman॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥

Om Jai Surya Bhagwan, Jai Ho Dinkar Bhagwan।
Jagat Ke Netra Swaroopa, Tum Ho Triguna Swaroopa।
Dharat Saba Hi Tab Dhyan, Om Jai Surya Bhagwan॥
॥ Om Jai Surya Bhagwan...॥
aartis.desc: Surya Dev, also known as Surya Bhagwan, is the Hindu god of the sun. He is often depicted as a young man with golden skin and wearing a yellow dhoti. His wife is the goddess Usha, and his son is the god Shani. Surya is considered the creator of the universe and the source of all life. He is also the patron god of farmers, as he is responsible for the growth of crops. The Surya Dev aarti is a devotional song dedicated to Surya Bhagwan. It is typically sung at sunrise or sunset, when the sun is at its highest or lowest point in the sky. The aarti consists of a series of Sanskrit mantras, which are chanted to invoke Surya's blessings. The aarti is often accompanied by the playing of traditional Indian instruments, such as the sitar or tabla.
aartis.title: Shri Surya Dev Om Jai Surya Bhagwan

aartis.content:
Aarti Shri Janak Dulari Ki ।
Sita Ji Shri Raghubar Pyaari Ki ॥
Jagat Janani Jag Ki Vistaarini,
Nitya Satya Saaket Viharini,
Param Dayamai Dinodharini,
Siya Maiya Bhaktan Hitkaari Ki ॥

Aarti Shri Janak Dulari Ki ।
Sita Ji Shri Raghubar Pyaari Ki ॥

Sita Sati Shiromani Pati Hit Kaarini,
Pati Seva Hit Van Van Charini,
Pati Hitt Pati Viyog Swikarini,
Tyag Dharam Murati Dhaari Ki ॥

Aarti Shri Janak Dulari Ki ।
Sita Ji Shri Raghubar Pyaari Ki ॥

Vimal Kirti Sab Lokan Chhai,
Naam Let Pavan Mati Aayi,
Sumirat Katat Kashta Dhukh Dai,
Sharnagat Jan Bhay Hari Ki ॥

Aarti Shri Janak Dulari Ki ।
Sita Ji Shri Raghubar Pyaari Ki ॥
aartis.desc: Sita Mata Aarti is a beautiful and devotional way to worship Goddess Sita. It is sung in the praise of Goddess Sita and is a very popular aarti among the devotees. aartis.title: Sita Mata Aarti

Aarti Tukarama ।

Abhaṅga Udaki Raksile.
Aarti Tukarama ॥

Brahma Tukasi Ale ॥

It is typically sung as part of a puja, or religious ceremony, to invoke the blessings of Tukaram. The lyrics of the aarti praise the saint's humility, devotion, and selfless service to humanity. aartis.content:
Tulsi Maharani Namo-Namo,
Hari ki Patrani Namo-Namo ।
Dhan Tulsi Puran Tap Kino,
Shaligram Bani Patrani ।
Jake Patra Manjari Komal,
Shripati Kamal Charan Laptani ॥

Dhoop-Deep-Navaidya Aarti,
Pusphpan ki Varsha Barsani ।
Chappan Bhog Chatisau Vyanjan,
Bin Tulsi Hari Ek Na Mani ॥

Sabhi Sakhi Maiya Tero Yash Gave,
Bhaktidan Deejay Maharani ।
Namo-Namo Tulsi Maharani,
Tulsi Maharani Namo-Namo ॥

Tulsi Maharani Namo-Namo,
Hari ki Patrani Namo-Namo ।
aartis.desc: The Tulsi Aarti is a beautiful prayer that is sung in honor of the Tulsi plant, which is considered to be a holy plant in Hinduism. The lyrics of the prayer praise the Tulsi plant for its many virtues, and express a desire to worship it. The Tulsi Aarti is a very popular prayer, and is often sung at Hindu festivals and celebrations.
aartis.title: Tulsi Aarti - Maharani Namo Namo

maiya vaibhav laxmi mata,

bhakton ke hitkarini,
sukh vaibhav daata,
om vaibhav laxmi mata.

laxmi maan ka naam jo leta,
sukh sampati paata,
maiya sukh sampati paata,
duhkh daridr mitata,
duhkh daridr mitata,
baanchhit phal paata.

om vaibhav laxmi mata,
maiya vaibhav laxmi mata,
bhakton ke hitkarini,
bhakton ke hitkarini,
sukh vaibhav daata,
om vaibhav laxmi mata.

laxmi mata too jag mata,
jag paalak raanee,
maiya jag paalak raanee,
haath jod gun gaate,
haath jod gun gaate,
jag ke sab praanee.

om vaibhav laxmi mata,

maan teree mamata pa ke,

The lyrics of the aarti praise Vaibhav Laxmi for her beauty, power and greatness, and express a desire to have her blessings. The aarti is often performed during religious festivals and celebrations, and is a popular way to show devotion to the goddess.

aartis.content:
Jai Vashnavi Mata, Maiya Jai Vashnavi Mata ।
Hath Jod Tere Aage, Aarti Mai Gaataa ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥
Sheesh Par Chatra Birajay, Murtiyan Pyaari ।
Ganga Bahti Charnan, Jyoti Jage Nyaari ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥

Brahma Ved Padhe Nit Dvare, Shankar Dhyan Dhare ।
Sevat Chanvar Dulavat, Narad Nritya Kare ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥

Sundar Gufa Tumhari, Mann ko Ati Bhave ।
Baar-Baar Dekhn ko, Ae Maa Mann Chave ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥

Bhawan Pe Jhande Jhulay, Ghanta Dhwani Baajay ।
Uncha Parvat Tera, Mata Priya Laagay ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥

Paan Supari Dhwaja nariyal, Bhent Pushp Mewa ।
Dass Khadde Charnon mai, Darshan Do Deva ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥

Jo Jan Nischay karke, Dwar Tere Aavay ।
Uski Ichchha Puran Mata Ho Jave ॥
॥ Jai Vashnavi Mata...॥

Itani Stuti Nishdin, Jo Nar Bhi Gave ।
Kahte Sevak Dhyanu, Sukh Sampati Pave ॥

Jai Vashnavi Mata, Maiya Jai Vashnavi Mata ।
Hath Jod Tere Aage, Aarti Mai Gaataa ॥
aartis.desc: The Vaishno Mata Aarti is a beautiful and spiritual song that is sung in praise of the Hindu goddess Vaishno Devi. The song is typically sung during the puja (worship) ceremony, and it is said to bring peace and blessings to those who listen to it. The lyrics of the Vaishno Mata Aarti are very beautiful and meaningful, and they express the deep love and devotion that Hindus have for their goddess. The Vaishno Mata Aarti is a very special and important part of Hindu religious tradition, and it is sure to bring peace and happiness to those who listen to it.
aartis.title: Vaishno Mata Aarti

aartis.content:
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini,
Koi Tera Paar Na Paya.

Paan Supari Dhwaja Nariyal.
Le Teri Bheint Charaya,
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.

Suva Choli Teri Ang Viraje.
Kesar Tilak Lagaya,
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.

Nange Pag Maa Akbar Aaya.
Sone Ka Chatra Charaya,
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.

Oonche Parvat Banyo Devalaya.
Niche Shahar Basaya,
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.

Satyug, Dwapar, Treta Madhye.
Kaliyug Raaj Savaya,
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.

Dhoop Deep Naivaidhya Aarti.
Mohan Bhog Lagaya,
Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.

Dhyanu Bhagat Maiya Tere Gun Gaya.
Mannvanchit Phal Paaya.

Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini.
Koi Tera Paar Na Paya.
aartis.desc: Vindhyeshvari Sun Meri Devi Parvat Vasini Aarti is a beautiful aarti dedicated to Goddess Vindhyeshwari. The lyrics of the aarti praise the Goddess for her mercy and compassion. They also ask for her blessings in all undertakings. The aarti is sung with great devotion and sincerity, and is sure to please the Goddess.

aartis.content:
Jai Shri Vishvakarma Prabhu,
Jai Shri Vishvakarma।
Sakal Srashti Ke Karata,
Rakshak Stuti Dharma॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥
Aadi Srashti Me Vidhi Ko,
Shruti Upadesh Diya।
Jeev Maatra Ka Jag Me,
Gyan Vikas Kiya॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥

Dhyan Kiya Jab Prabhu Ka,
Sakal Siddhi Aai।
Rishi Angeera Tap Se,
Shanti Nahin Pai॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥

Rog Grast Raja Ne,
Jab Aashray Leena।
Sankat Mochan Banakar,
Door Duhkha Keena॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥

Jab Rathakar Dampati,
Tumhari Ter Kari।
Sunakar Deen Prarthana,
Vipat Hari Sagari॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥

Ekanan Chaturanan,
Panchanan Raje।
Tribhuj Chaturbhuj Dashabhuj,
Sakal Roop Saaje॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥

Dhyan Dhare Tab Pad Ka,
Sakal Siddhi Aave।
Man Dwuvidha Mit Jave,
Atal Shakti Pave॥
॥ Jai Shri Vishvakarma...॥

Shri Vishvakarma Ki Aarti,
Jo Koi Gaave।
Bhajat Gajanand Swami,
Sukh Sampati Pave॥

Jai Shri Vishvakarma Prabhu,
Jai Shri Vishvakarma।
Sakal Srashti Ke Karata,
Rakshak Stuti Dharma॥
aartis.desc: Vishwakarma Aarti is a beautiful devotional song dedicated to Lord Vishwakarma, the Hindu god of architecture and engineering. The lyrics of the song praise Lord Vishwakarma's creative abilities and describe him as the supreme creator who has designed and built all the wonderful things in the world. The song is a perfect way to show our reverence and gratitude to Lord Vishwakarma for his countless blessings.
aartis.title: Vishwakarma Aarti
